references.paper_title: Iterative hard thresholding for compressed sensing
references.reason: This paper introduces the Iterative Hard Thresholding (IHT) algorithm, which is a key foundation for the I-OBS algorithm proposed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Second order derivatives for network pruning: Optimal brain surgeon
references.reason: This paper introduces the Optimal Brain Surgeon (OBS) framework, which is the direct inspiration for the I-OBS algorithm and the core concept of using second-order information for pruning.

references.paper_title: Optimal brain surgeon: Extensions and performance comparisons
references.reason: This paper extends the OBS framework, providing further insights and comparisons that inform the development of I-OBS.
This foundational paper introduces the Optimal Brain Damage (OBD) framework, a precursor to OBS that also uses curvature information for weight pruning, and is closely related to the I-OBS approach.

references.paper_title: WoodFisher: Efficient second-order approximation for neural network compression
references.reason: This paper introduces the WoodFisher algorithm, which is shown to be a special case of the I-OBS algorithm, establishing a direct connection between existing methods and the proposed framework.
